website_summaries.verdict: This large tent can hold up to 6 people and is built to handle all kinds of camping weather conditions.
pros: Screen room provides a breezy place to sleep on hot nights
Lots of room inside this tent
Does a good job of keeping you dry in the rain
cons: The set-up is not as intuitive as other tents on the market and it may take you a little longer to figure out the first time

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this tent for almost 4 years. It has served us well. It is easy to set up. Have done it alone in no time at all. We waterproofed it the first year and have had no problems. Comfortable to stand up in. We loved the screened in portion. We always face it to a nice view to wake up to. Pleanty of room for cots, son's toys, and of course the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G

customer_reviews.title: Tonnes of room and great to have the screened area for gear etc
customer_reviews.text: Finally a tent that I can move around in!! Tonnes of room and great to have the screened area for gear etc. Setup was easier than I expected, but you'll need 2 people. We just use it for the two of us and have a large queen bed inside. There's room for side tables and clothing bags with about 2-3 feet before the screened area begins. It's fairly large but not overkill in my opinion. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: briandrew1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent for camping
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tent for years. Up until recently it has lasted at least six years before we went camping this past year and left my friend's dog in the tent to help them out. There was a thunderstorm while we were out on the lake in the boat, and the dog apparently does not like thunderstorms. Their pup push the through the screen that I had left open for breathing and oxygen flow. They brought this tent for me to replace the one that was destroyed. It is the same attention that I had before. I love this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C

customer_reviews.title: Wasted space
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this tent for our little family of 3, but really thought that the outside part was wasted space. Especially since having it would allow bugs and anything small to come in from the outside into the main tent space. We tried it with a rug just trying to make it work, but I still hated it. If the outside space was enclosed with a bottom that is connected to the main tent bottom I might have kept it. I instructed my husband to leave it for the bears the last time we camped in it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: One mom set up with a baby on my hip!
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman WeatherMaster 6 was a great tent. We used it a few times a month, during 3 seasons, for 6 years. The tent never leaked. It slept me and my 3 kids very comfortably, with plenty of extra room. I had no problem getting the tent up on my own. Sometimes with a baby on my hip:)
customer_reviews.author: Outdoormom

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement.
customer_reviews.text: I am in the rain right now, using this tent for this first time, and I’m just watching the water come in. It’s been lightly raining for maybe 3 hours. The directions were an absolute nightmare. It was also TERRIBLE at retaining heat. I run a buddy heater in my tent, and my 15 year old 5 man tent does a WAY better job of keeping the warmth in. I used this tent in November, fully expecting it to keep me warm, given the fact that it’s titled “Weathermaster,” however anytime the wind blew, the frigid air cut right through the mesh opening under the rain fly. I would not recommend this tent for any season.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hayes

customer_reviews.title: We love our Weathermaster 10!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tent May 21, 2017 (it is now October). Great investment! We have two queen air mattresses (one on each end of the tent) and there is room for a table and chairs in the middle! Previous reviews have stated that it is difficult to pitch this tent with only one person, however, if you are tent savvy, it's not that hard. Great tent, excellent construction. We always hang a tarp above our tents (for rain) but we had a BAD thunderstorm with BLOWING rain and we stayed dry all night! Highly recommended! We love our Weathermaster 10!
customer_reviews.author: Geojunkie_George

customer_reviews.title: do your research!
customer_reviews.text: I did my research on tents of this size, features and price range and the fact this one has the screened in foyer which is a considerable feature. At my senior years I demand full head room when I arise and stretch my tired old a**. It has gravity and is a fine base camp tent and yet with its weight it is easy for this old fool to set up and break down. My only gripe is that it is a bit noisey in the wind, but then again I camp a lot in Death Valley-----Winnnnnndy!!----------JP
customer_reviews.author: desert dog

customer_reviews.title: Quality product ... rotten instructions and support ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembled the tent fairly easily, with many parts left over, and I still have no idea how to properly install the rainfly. I managed to get it up, and it withstood a decent downpour. I stayed dry, but there was NO air moving through the tent while the rainfly was installed. Coleman's instructions leave much to be desired, and there's no video on YouTube or the Coleman website that could offer any help. Hoping to find a sherpa somewhere that can help me for my next summer excursion. The tent itself is quite nice, and I look forward to camping in cooler weather with a clear forecast, so that the rainfly isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Good for dry weather camping.  Not RAIN!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this tent for a few years and it has been a good dry weather tent. Lat year it saw its first steady but not heavy rainfall. I returned to the tent just before dark with my sleepy three year old to put him to bed and found a PUDDLE! in the middle of our bed. I'm talking total saturation. There was no sleeping in the tent that night. Thankfully I was only camping an hour drive away from home and we went home for the night. So much for camping. This tent does not hold up in rain. Though we have enjoyed it in dry weather often.
customer_reviews.author: Caryn

customer_reviews.title: Fabric feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: The first time setting up the tent took a little longer than advertised for obvious reasons. The problem I have is fabric feels extremely cheap and not as good of quality as my other Coleman tent. We had one stitched area pop (sorry no photo) which causes concern, especially once we get this out to the camp grounds. The tab on the bag that you hold to zip the bag ripped on first use, though not a functional issue it is still a concern. Not your typical Coleman product in my opinion. Almost like it's a knock off. Still haven't used for a camping trip. This review is based on the initial set up to familiarize myself with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for family camping
customer_reviews.text: The tent is fairly easy to set up, has a lot of room for a family and has been a good shelter for our family camping! We enjoy the "porch" feature which keeps the bugs out and gives some shade. The roof breathes so the night don't have the build up of condensation while we sleep but the secondary rain tarp keeps the weather out. It fits a queen and twin air mattress pretty well, to get the full "6" capacity I would only venture to guess everyone would have to be in sleeping bags and stuffed in there like chickens. I wouldn't call it light-weight but it certainly serves as perfect for our style of outings.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Dry and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We set this up before a four-day rain/wind front. It held up will and stayed dry. I like this tent very much and the sturdy design. I also purchased two tarps, one for the inside floor, and a larger tarp to cover the entire ground footprint including the screen area. Happy camping. Update 6/17/19: Weekend camping with the tent went great. Still very happy with all aspects of it. Easy set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent needs some personal design adjustments to be better.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would change about this tent is the main support poles. There is no reason it needs the heavy steel assembly pole when the heavy duty fibres glass tent poles would do. By replacing the poles I reduced the weight by almost 2 lbs. For a tent this big that's a lot. I also stitched in a ripstop tarp as flooring for the screened porch area which keeps all the little critters out that otherwise have access to your gear that's not in the sleeping area. Not sure why this wasn't the design, but i guess its cheaper. Otherwise it's a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: jnsnfl

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a great tent. We got caught in a mild storm the first night we used it abc it stayed dry. I did treat it prior to our trip. It’s pretty easy to set up with two people. Two queen Matt’s fit in the main area but don’t leave much room to move around. This is the perfect tent for a couple that wants extra room. We camped with two adults and two kids and it worked great but next time we will get the kids their own tent. I definitely love this tent
customer_reviews.author: RobJr

customer_reviews.title: Luxury tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent because I wanted one I could stand up easily in and this one is perfect. The door feature is great to get in and out of and the interior feels very spacious. There are lots of windows for cross air breeze. It is easy to set up. I like how the storage bag has the instructions stitched to the inside of the bag so you'll always have it handy. The only thing I would warn people about is that this tent needs to be staked down or else it will not withstand the slightest breeze. Also I wish it had a few more storage pockets. Other than that it is the best tent I've ever been in.
customer_reviews.author: Shiao-En Lee

customer_reviews.title: Camping first timer
customer_reviews.text: This tent is easy to put together after I watched some YouTube videos. The metal stakes are garbage and they all bent and kept coming out of the ground. We actually woke up in the night to a one part of the tent falling on us.... we thought it was a bear. Definitely buy better stakes. The tent is nice the top it completely open mesh, camping in hot weather that was nice for a Breeze at night. The zippers on the door are a little confusing but once you figure it out it makes sense. Overall a good purchase... kinda pricey but it will last many years (I hope)
customer_reviews.author: Kmazey

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Withstood a decent amount of wind. Big, with a ton of space. Plenty ventilation. The hinged door is awesome. And the mesh roof is perfect for nice clear warm nights. Pretty easy to set up, even though the instructions are not the best. We did use kiwi heavy duty waterproof spray on the tent and the rain fly for added protection.
customer_reviews.author: Emaly

customer_reviews.title: Coleman is the best
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great tent. It is very easy to put up with 2 people. It can be done with 1 person but takes time with all the walking around. I think the best feature is what I call the porch. If it's raining it is definitely better than being stuck in the tent. Just make sure you waterproof it first and seal the seems like you should do with all tents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great tent.
customer_reviews.text: We just went tent camping for the first time in years. What a great tent. We initially thought it would be too big, but it was just right for two adults with cots and and some room to spare. It was all it claimed to be. We slept through a downpour, no water came in. We loved the "hinged" door.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: A waterproof house made of nylon!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive tent! We stayed dry in the heaviest downpour ever in Yellowstone park. As large as a Motel 6 room, there are acres of space to stow your gear, even with a queen mattress inside. Plenty of windows, a swing door, and a front porch, many features to customize your new home. Set up is complex but gets easier each time. Pictograph instructions are terrible thus the loss of a rating star. Rainfly in particular was unclear how the side tensioners work. Other campers remarked that it is a cool thing to behold. Great value, Coleman quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gordius

customer_reviews.title: Love the door and skylight
customer_reviews.text: We survived a terrible thunderstorm with hard rain, big lightning and strong winds, several miles from civilization and NO water got into the tent. Not a drop. There is plenty of room and when is not raining, the screened in skylight is a wonderful way to watch the stars as you fall asleep. The door is AMAZING. It’s the best tent door I have ever seen/used ... it’s probably the best feature of the tent. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: KatQ

customer_reviews.title: Not an instant cabin
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an instant cabin type, but I can still get this up on my own in under 30 minutes if I follow directions...it is comfortable inside and very airy, especially when both rooms are open into each other...would have preferred the screen room to hang a floor
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Riley

customer_reviews.title: Have set it up
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if it's water proof or water resistant. I went ahead and water proof the seems around the windows and doors ect. Love the door its like a door when you add the poles. Love all the room. Wasn't looking for one with the poles but that's what I got, is harder for me to put up, the directions are in the bag on three second page I don't use them. I think it says it's 14 pounds it weighs more than my 15 pound cat. But I love the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Huge tent
customer_reviews.text: The product details do not do this tent justice. This is a massive tent. Not good for hiking to your campsite but for car camping this is like a hotel! It's pretty easy to set up and take down. There's some finnagling at first as the poles are self supporting based on how they're staked in the ground. However it's well worth it especially if you're having a family outing. My only con about this tent is that the bags the poles and stakes come in are kind of cheap and tore immediately. Nothing a little bit of duct tape can't solve but not a reason to not love the quality of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. McKenzieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Just be ready to be frustrated.
customer_reviews.text: We finally had a chance to put this tent up - because of weather. It offered the WORST instructions I have ever seen. It took us WAY to long to put this up. I learned more looking at the picture than from the instructions. Having said that, we will put it up again in the near future and I will up the rating (I hope) as we start to us it. There are some videos YT videos that might help. I think I may do my own and show you where everything goes was when putting this up. If you buy this tent, just be ready to get frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: michaelj

customer_reviews.title: Don't put anything inside the tent you want to keep dry!
customer_reviews.text: Rained inside the tent more than outside! Rain fly was not sealed from the factory!! Ruined a few dry items and gear I thought were safe inside the tent. After contacting Coleman and trying to resolve the issue to no resolve Coleman has lost a life long customer.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Carney

customer_reviews.title: ... on our last 2 camping trips and it's totally awesome! Best tent we've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: We've used this on our last 2 camping trips and it's totally awesome! Best tent we've ever owned! Super easy to setup and take down, even in the dark, which was us on our last trip. This is a great tent for 2 adults and 2 small children and I'm sure it would work for 6 adults as well. Plenty of room inside and the screened in area is a wonderful feature. The kids can play in there while the parents are setting up camp. The screened in area also kept the wasps out while we ate dinner one night. Overall - very impressed with this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Dale McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used it once and so far love it! Not too difficult to put up and it’s very spacious! We had 3 adults and 2 kids air mattresses and cots fit no problem with PLENTY of room for luggage. Comes with a sheet to use as a room divider as well. The tiny door mat was useless so we chucked it. Better to use a larger tarp for the door mat. The front door was great very convenient with the swing close door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well - spent a week in it with 6 kids a dog and a cat
customer_reviews.text: Definitely got my family out of a bind when we arrived to move into our new house and the closing date had been pushed back a week. We stayed in this tent, all eight of us, including a newborn baby, dog, and cat. It held up just fine and really wasn't very cramped at all considering how many of us there were. For nearly 8 days we stayed in this tent. It was hot, it rained, there was a windstorm. It held up.
customer_reviews.author: Locke

customer_reviews.title: The door, screen room, and mesh roof make this the perfect tent.
customer_reviews.text: We used this several times and it rained. It stayed dry. The small front screen fits 2 chairs and a small table, perfect for reading the morning paper and having a cup of coffee. The door is AMAZING, and quite an improvement over constant zippering. It fits one twin and stuff in each "room" or a queen and stuff in both rooms. With the rain fly off, you are sleeping under the stars. Great tent so far!
customer_reviews.author: MargoLouiso

customer_reviews.title: very easy to put up by yourself and i loved the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent for the first three days of bow season, no leaks, very easy to put up by yourself and i loved the hinged door. Three of us slept in it with cots and some of our gear and we had a card table in there with three chairs and we had plenty of room. The tub floor was also nice, no leaks. We did put a tarp over the tent because we had high winds and hard rain constantly. We staked only the four corners and the guide ropes and the tent stayed sturdy. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: TONY S. HERBERS

customer_reviews.title: Good but could have been way better!
customer_reviews.text: The best you can get but still not good enough for the average family of five. Coleman has had way better offerings in the past for about the same price but the D-door is good and I like it. The back doors should be D-doors but they are not. There is not nearly enough pocket storage and there is not way to run extension cords into the tent which totally sucks. Also the tent will leak like crazy until you use tons of seam sealer which I think sucks!. I was willing to pay more but Coleman wasn't willing to offer me more! What's up with that?
customer_reviews.author: H. james

customer_reviews.title: It’s huge!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge, we fit 2 adult size cots and 4 smaller cots (not kids size, about as long as a normal cot, but only 23” wide) in this without any problem, 4 kids cots fit in one “room” and the 2 adult ones fit in the other room with room to move around. Haven’t tried it in the rain, but it was fairly windy and we had no issues, although I already had some upgraded aluminum stakes from a previous tent. Based on its design, I think this tent will fare much better in rain than my previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin F McClure

customer_reviews.title: Roomy tent!!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used the tent a couple of times. Easy to set up and take down although it does take about 15 minutes with two people. There is plenty of room for a queen size and a twin size mattress in the main enclosed part with room to spare for bags, etc... 2 queen mattresses would fit with a little room to spare at the foot of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: DevonD

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Only issue we are having is a seam leak on both sides of the rear and one near the door. Nothing some spray won't fix. Fantastic tent for the price. It did great in terrible terrible weather straight otb! Set up is simple and sturdy. The "patio" it awesome. The hinged door is a very nice addition as well. It will fit 2 queen size mattress' with a little bit of foot space.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great space!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is heavy, you be taking it backpacking... If you’re set up In a spot for more than a few days, this tent is PERFECT!!!! A single individual can set it up (albeit, with some difficulty). I’d recommend this for any multi-day stay at a single location. There is ample room for your queen blow up mattress and 2 backpacks with clothes. The screened in porch and self closing side door are great additions. There were lots of mosquitoes and bees when I used this tent, and the screened porch kept all the bugs away from the sleeping area. I love this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love the door, love the value, love staying dry!
customer_reviews.text: The hinged door is PERFECT for our fam of 5 in & out endlessly. Easy set up & I like that the main body has metal sturdy poles. Roomy inside for my tall husband, me, & 3 kids. It'll hold 6 adults comfortably! We also camped in a thunderstorm and in the morning our campsite was a flooded muddy mess while inside the tent was incredibly dry. We've never had such a high performing tent. So affordable for a family with a bunch of kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent for more space for a our growing family. The height is great; you can stand up completely! It was also extremely easy to put together; my husband and I had it up in 15 mins on the first try. We love the screened ceiling so we can fall asleep under the stars. If it rains the fly is easy to put over the tent within 2 mins. We also really like the swinging door; it makes going in and out with the baby and other things so much easier. We sprayed this with extra waterproofing for just in case so I don't know just how waterproof (or resistant) it truly is.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Sweet !
customer_reviews.text: My family has done lots of camping in this sucker and we love it! Had several nights with rain storms in it too and never got wet. Only design flaw is there is a mesh pocket under one of the windows that will collect water if there is a little bit of weight in it. (cell phone) It takes a little time setting up but its got lots of room and we have used the front screened porch more than I though we ever would. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wakkah Wakkah !!!

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable tent but not easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: I can't open a bottle of catsup; but somehow I bent one of the metal poles so badly the first time I set the tent up that I will have to replace it! It took me (70 years old with Parkinson's and low blood pressure) 4 hours to get it up. If my husband hadn't come out to help once I figured out where the poles went (It's uncertain which pole goes where the first time; I'll label them next time!) I couldn't have gotten it up. It definitely takes 2 people, and my husband has little patience with that sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The tent was difficult to put up and take down. Instructions included were for a LARGER tent (useless).Also we really liked the screened porch. BUT, and this is a huge but, this tent leaked from day one.
customer_reviews.author: THE INSIDER

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a great tent?
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to get back into tent camping for sometime now. So, I did my research. I wanted something easy to put up and weather proof, without breaking the bank. I have yet to go camping in a heavy down pour, but I love this tent. The first time we put it up it only took 20 minutes. I'm looking forward to many years of camping with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: This tent IS a WeatherMASTER!
customer_reviews.text: This tent took on 65 mi per hr wind gusts like a boss! We stay comfy and dry in torrential rains! Excellent quality tent!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Unable to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Glad we tried to assemble before our trip. Directions didn't match the tent we bought, and the material was too tight to fit around poles and poles too long to snap into clips at the bottom. Tried for almost an hour. You get what you pay for - should have known a 10 person tent for under $200 was a bunch of junk. Had a Kelty before, will never try a Coleman again. So it's Kelty or REI for us for the future. Costs more, but at least we'll be able to put it up.
customer_reviews.author: west coast arts

customer_reviews.title: Robust tent with lots of room
customer_reviews.text: Tent sleeps 4 adults or 2 adults and a stack of kids easily. The netted porch is really nice in the evenings and easy to use. It is not a particularly lightweight tent but it isn't a canvas beast either. Set up is easy and doesn't take long at all, seems to be very waterproof but i haven't had it in a true downpour yet.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: ... definitely use more pockets and the door mat is nice and all
customer_reviews.text: Could definitely use more pockets and the door mat is nice and all, but a zip in floor (or whatever) would have been way better for the mesh room. Also, mesh room really sucks it for rain protection. Not only does mesh room sans floor suck for a kitchen and shoe storage because critters and creepy things just roll right in off the ground, but everything in there gets drenched with rain. It was a light rain, and the main cabin stayed alot more dry than wet... the sides were still sopping wet, all the luggage on the sides was wet, and 8" puddles formed in the lowground of the main tent.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Good size tent and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Not an avid camper - Set it up at home first to learn it and it was easy, then the first actual setup was a breeze. This tent is a great size for my family of 3 to have a queen air bed and space inside, inside height is good. The inclusion of a door is cool too. Coleman must have listened to older reviews about plastic stakes too because mine came with both metal and plastic stakes. I also don't know if it always had this, but the bag can be expanded to make it easier to pack everything back in.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grimsley

customer_reviews.title: Just an okay tent
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this tent. However, I had a few issues. For starters, if you fold it up like you would with other tents, it will not fit back into the bag. The directions do not explain at all how to fit it back into the bag. It leaked a little bit the first time I used it. I had to treat it with a rain proofing product. Also, one of the poles for the door has broken. It broke the 2nd time I used it. On the plus side, the metal poles are super easy to put up. I normally love Coleman products, but this one not so much.
customer_reviews.author: robert johnson

customer_reviews.title: 2 Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: We have now official camped in our tent and we couldn’t be happier. We have 3 boys (7,4, and 1 under a year) and setup was easy and fast. It’s a little tight fit with 3 air mattresses (1 queen & 2 twin), however no one complained. We got unsuspected Florida showers and the only thing to make it inside the tent was a little condensation. We are aware that any camping tent will need updated stakes, other than that it looks like we are really going to enjoy our tent camping experiences. We have a year full of family camping trips planned, so I intend on updating our experience with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Conceicao

customer_reviews.title: Leaks even after water proofing
customer_reviews.text: Was able to setup alone just had to stake down foot print 1st which was pretty awesome for a tent this size. But it leaks from all the horizontal seams near the floor and especially the windows, even after waterproofing. It is a nice size tent with a large "porch" area that had me excited for camping this season. Design so bad I probably wont buy another coleman product.
customer_reviews.author: starguy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a tent that withstands the weather.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tent for a full camping season. It's sturdy, stable, has plenty of room and fairly easy to put up. However, there's nothing "WeatherMaster" about it. Water will come right through the fabric unless you apply some sort of waterproofing to the tent material and seams. The open mesh ceiling makes it impossible to retain heat, even with the fly attached, making cold nights a nightmare. I can't recommend this tent for anything other than dry, summer camping.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeyeted

customer_reviews.title: Coleman weathermaster 10 2020
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t seam seal yet but had no leaks. Door that some people like/don’t like I loved. Setup was simple, best with 2 people. Used a queen size air mattress and had room on both sides of the bed, plus room on the other 1/2 of the tent. Tall ceiling, lots of room. Overall great 1st time using this model. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent held up! My family went camping on top of a mountain. At first there was a little confusion about how to set the tent up, but we quickly overcame that fact. It rained like cats and dogs the first night and no rain came in the tent , other than what was tracked in by foot traffic. The next night hurricane Michael blew through, the high winds pulled up the stakes holding up one side, I had to tether the poles to a tree and tighten the rain fly with a piece of paracord. Now this was some pretty darn rough conditions but I thought that the Coleman weather master held up to all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a family of 4. We put a queen air mattress and a kid bunk bed cot in it. Very happy with the tent. I've been a heavy camper for years but always as a backwoods hiking guy. First venture into car camping. The hinge door is a sweet feature. It makes getting I. And out so much easier. You also don't have to zip the door, it stays shut on its own sufficiently to keep bugs and weather out, even in aheavy storm. No leaks after first use, a weeklong trip to Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Coolpeople

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent !!
customer_reviews.text: Used the tent once so far this year and it was easy to set up and take down. The poles are nice steel poles instead of the junk fiber glass ones you get with most tents these days. It was the perfect amount of space four my four children, wife, myself and our large dog. the front screened in porch is very nice to have and i am positive it will a lot more useful when the mosquitoes are out. All and all I am very happy with the tent and plan to use it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It is great, the only issue is that is is heavy
customer_reviews.text: It is great , the only issue is that is is heavy, the installation guide is not good, it cost some time to assemble it for the first time . But it is still a good product
customer_reviews.author: yhzz

customer_reviews.title: Nice but broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Set it up once in the backyard. Then when I used it for the first time, the thin pole that bends and creates the swinging door snapped and it poke through the fabric of the tent. Pretty pissed about it. Really thought it would be our family tent for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The tent itself is Ok, and it is very spacious in the tent. But when the rain is not light, it leaks a little. it also move a bit in winds. and the nails holding up the tent have to be tight or it move in wind, and the nails are hard to pull out if you do that plus will go crooked . it was also missing a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for car camping
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product that is backed up by good customer service. I used this camping for a week in which it rained for 3 nights. No leaks in the tent at all. Please keep in mind that it is always a good idea to spray a new tent with silicon type spray that is meant to be used on tents before use. I always use a ground tarp and pick a good level spot to place the tent. Set up is easy but having a 2nd set of hands is recommended and practice setting it up before your trip. Very spacious inside and I could stand up in it (I'm 6'0).
customer_reviews.author: Brian L Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Cannot go wrong with this as your family or scouts tent
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this tent! Our sons joined Cub Scouts a little over a year ago. We have used this tent on 4 camping trips in the last year. Some trips were shortened by the Camp due to extreme weather, and this tent handled it all. East Texas heat and rain don’t stand a chance!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This tent was perfect! I knew my outdoorsman husband would be picky about which tent so I did a lot of research. He loved it! And I did too. Love the space and the height. Love the screened area - our son set up a table and he said that was his house all weekend. It rained and there were no leaks at all...although it was just a light rain so cannot attest for downpours yet. It took 2 people to set up...but it was still fairly simple ... Took about 15 minutes. Very happy with this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maier

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality control
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, however I unboxed it on a camping trip with no cell coverage. The directions turned out to be for the 14 man. No cell coverage meant we were figuring this out at 9 at night. We got the main supports in. Went to sleep, the next morning I set out early to get coverage and a copy of the real directions while everyone slept in. As with any tent: get your own stakes.
customer_reviews.author: yomama

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great
customer_reviews.text: Tent tent is very roomy. You can stand up in it. It was easy to put up, good idea to mark the polls to make it even more easy the next. One of the Very skinny thin poles did break/ split down the middle and I’m waiting for Coleman to give me a new one. One complaint I have is that they don’t instruct you on how to put up the wall for privacy. It doesn’t seem to fit any which way I’ve tried and I just don’t know how to make it work. I sealed it as some folks had said it could leak we didn’t have rain so I was fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the Coleman brand!
customer_reviews.text: Fabric is super delicate! Ended up with two tares The very first time we set it up. We do a lot of camping and are very familiar with setting up tents this one was difficult and took three of us because all the sides had to be held until steamed down or it just fell. I love the space in this tent. I also love the door. We are exchanging it in hopes that the next one is better because I do like it, but disappointed with the Coleman brand
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Brown

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the door feature on this tent used it during ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the door feature on this tent used it during this deer season in cold weather you're going to want a warm sleeping bag since the top is mostly screen had it on a very windy and rainy night with door facing the wind little bit of rain came in but not bad I expect that from a tent next time I will try putting the smallest side of the tent so putting the tent sideways towards the wind and rain and I think it will help very large tent fits 3cots with plenty of room for 3 people to get ready
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The first of the weekend was fine. However the second night rained and the rain ...
customer_reviews.text: The first of the weekend was fine. However the second night rained and the rain fly dripped in multiple spots through the mesh screen on the top of the tent. No one touched the tent top and it was not at a seam. When I got home I packed the tent, called Amazon, and sent the tent back. Amazon was great with the returns process. The most upsetting part of the tent was it was guarantee that the tent would not leak. So much for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent..... but it does leak
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice looking, well made tent. However, the name “Weathermaster” isn’t exactly fitting. I waterproofed it thoroughly and still had some minor leaking in a moderate rain storm. It seeped through a few different seams. Although it wasn’t a ton of water, I can’t imagjne how it would’ve been if I didn’t waterproof. Set up is relatively easy and the large poles are heavy duty. We found the size to be perfect for our family of 5 and could easily have a 6th person join us.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Busted pole, Coleman has not responded.
customer_reviews.text: A pole length adjuster busted on first use. Emailed Coleman and no customer support response. The tent is useable, but should not have to deal with a defective pole with a new tent. The tent worked well on our off grid trip otherwise. Emailed Coleman and no customer support response. Maybe a negative review will help get a response.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bagley

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome to be able to see the stars at night
customer_reviews.text: I am a campground host so I live in this thing for 6 months at a time. It is awesome to be able to see the stars at night. However, I don't see how it is a weather "master". It lets all the wind in from underneath the rain flap. It holds no heat when it is cold. I taped together a few emergency blankets (those ones that kinda look like foil) and put them under the rain flap with duct tape. This fixed the problem with rain and holding heat. The tent was especially ineffective during wind with rain combo. It would come right up under the rain flap...
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Major leaking from bottom seams. Significant water leakage from 24 hours of light rain and this is after we spray sealed, seam sealed, and placed tarps above the tent. The tent is spacious and the hinged door was better than I expected and quite convenient. The tents I purchased from Walmart have held up for years, this was the first use of the Coleman Weathmaster and it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Haeven

customer_reviews.title: this is our primary tent when camping
customer_reviews.text: my wife and I use this when camping. its very spacious inside. we can set up our full size cot and a folding table and still have room to walk around. before our first trip we coated this with scotch guard and seam sealed it and we haven't had any issues. Its not the easiest tent to set up but its not bad.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy instructions and incorrect parts list.
customer_reviews.text: Review partially based on poor assembly instructions and parts list. Both showed tent should have come with 12 metal poles instead of the 9 recieved. After an hour of watching YouTube videos and fumbling with the damn tent like I was in a Simpsons or Family Guy episode I finally got it figured out. Based on previous reviews I also emptied a bottle of waterproofing spray on it in anticipation of the 4 day 3 night campout planned with the family this week. Will update with performance review after trip.
customer_reviews.author: Anp5417

customer_reviews.title: good tent, but end tips of poles already broke off..
customer_reviews.text: We used our tent for the first time yesterday. It rained and the tent held up in the rain fine. it was spacious and we love the door opening feature. The tent really needs to be steaked into the ground; at the very least at the 4 corners. Otherwise the tent is not as stable and the corners of the tent don't expand...So probably not good for camping on a surface that you can't use steaks....Finally when we were taking down the tent and collapsing the poles severe of the end tips fell off and are now lost--disappointing....
customer_reviews.author: Hawks

customer_reviews.title: Blew over in a rain storm, leaked, poles broke and rusted.  Had less than 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. Water leaked through the first time we used it. Had the tent set up to dry out and it ended up storming. The tent blew down and two of the poles broke. The rest of the remaining poles have now rusted and we can not use the tent again. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Tiana Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Not for hiking very heavy and leaks
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and difficult to put up with 2 adults. Not made for hiking or even constantly raining areas. Over the summer went to pigeon forge Tennessee. Rented a space to set up camp in Smokey mountain area. Plenty of space for my family of 4 and some weird kid to kept inviting herself over. It leaked some so everything was wet. I’d say get if you’re going somewhere with a dry moderate climate. And not hiking this thing weighs about 50-80 lbs I think. Has 2 rooms or 1 very big room decent cross ventilation. Definitely not for colder climates.
customer_reviews.author: Laif Buczek

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Took the tent camping without setting it up prior, still in the box. Rookie mistake, but it was missing a few poles, most importantly the center poles. Bought it a while back and just left it packaged until the day I went camping so it is far past return, very sad as this was expensive .
customer_reviews.author: GetPants

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I woundnt waste your money on this, if you are planning on camping in rain than I woundnt even look at it. Keep looking. It would be ok for a nice sunny weather but If you gonna use it in rainy season. Keep looking. I wouldn’t recommend to anyone. Add another couple of hundred than you can get a decent rain proof tent. In my experience it’s wasn’t worth the money. If I knew it was gonna leak, I would just bought one for cheaper from Walmart!
customer_reviews.author: prabin

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to the wind like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews, so an item has to really get my attention in a good or bad way to get me to write one. This tent has impressed me. We just got back from a desert trip where the wind was howling and a constant sand storm. This tent never gave up. It shook hard but never failed. The tent next to it kept collapsing but not this one. The trip was not as fun as it could have been but at least we had a place to hide out. Also loved the fact that we didn't need to unzip the door every time we wanted to go in or out.
customer_reviews.author: FITNESS BOUND

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tent
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have reached the age where camping must be comfortable. This tent was roomy and great quality. We can fit our queen sized Coleman bed, a table, a child, and a dog with lots of room to spare. Someone posted but this tent now in there review, and I’m glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Michel Slover

customer_reviews.title: Tent leaks
customer_reviews.text: The 1st time used in the rain and it leaked. Tent is not named appropriately. Also instructions on inside of tent bag are for a similar but different tent style.
customer_reviews.author: Eric 100% dad

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! worked well... rain and wind. Once you get it up a time or two... pretty simple. I dared not to try by myself, but with hubby help, no problem. It rained, and I didn't have the protectant on it... no leaking but I wrapped it back up in the nice carrying bag wet, and needless to say, when I took it out, mildew was on the material. Not sure how to get that off yet, without ruining it.
customer_reviews.author: Lexus1

customer_reviews.title: Not weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: The tent design is bound to fail. The rainfly does not cover enough of the tent to keep it dry. There is no canopy on the outside so when you open the hinged door rain comes in. Water leaks in around all the seams. The window panel that keeps the rain out is behind the mesh screen, rain comes down in between the two and then seeps through the seams. My last tent was a Coleman and was really good quality so this was a big disappointment. If you buy this tent I would recommend getting a tarp to cover the whole thing as it will leak.
customer_reviews.author: Lizmac

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for thise that frequently go in and out.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! Love the hinged door and get many compliment from friends on it. There’s only 2 complaints... the smaller poles which have bungee cords in them, the bungee has broken down after 1 year of use and the poles don’t spring together anymore. Last compliant would be the storage bag quality. It’s a very thin cheap fabric that ripped right away. Otherwise I believe this tent would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: samiam

customer_reviews.title: Coleman weathermaster tent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to put up second time around w my 17 yr old dgt ...read instructions the first time! Awesome size as there was plenty of room for us, 2 queen size air matress, air chair n stool, small folding beach table, clothes etc. 2 exit doors with the awesome hinge door in front, regular zip one in back, room panel divider included if needed, plenty of Windows for ventilation, kept us dry from rain storms but I always spray w water repellent sealer prior to initial usage. Easy to fold/roll back in carrier bag Using pole bag as ur length guide. Very happy w this tent! Good price for the size. Using it again in Aug.
customer_reviews.author: Pugs4me

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tent. Once you figure out how to put ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent. Once you figure out how to put it together (the instructions aren't very helpful) its very easy. The height is slightly adjustable, and there are lots of windows. Only downside is the screen porch doesnt have a floor. We used a tarp under the entire tent, which solved the problem. The screen area makes a great pet enclosure to keep them cool from the sun. We fit 2 cots and a queen size mattress.. and it barely fit. We had 4 people in the tent. I can't say anything about how it fares in the rain, the rainfly, or how it holds up to wind. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kanuanuhea

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and overrated
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping. Pole broke on set up and stakes bent too. Side ripped and tent leaks. I would say this tent is good for backyard camping and camping at a campsite that looks like your backyard. Not to be used out in the wilderness. And this tent used to be $100 less a year ago. Do not buy this overpriced tent. Spend the couple hundred and get a hammock with mosquito netting and it will work out better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and lots of space!
customer_reviews.text: Set up went great, recommend two people. Loved the swinging door, especially for kids. Fit two queen mattress cots plus two dog beds with two large dogs with space to spare. Good ventilation but is bright and hot in the sun. Great purchase for a great price. No rain so I can’t speak to leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent!
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed it only only twice so far, and found it to be a quality tent! Easy to set up and take down. Only one falsehood, the statement that 2 queen size air mattress would fit! Not true. There's no way! We had ours turned every way and only one would fit in this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: We love it. The new style door on this tent ...
customer_reviews.text: We love it. The new style door on this tent is a huge plus with the Velcro and fiberglass poles that works like an actual door. Much less wear and tear on the zipper going in and out all the time. Instructions were a little vague, but after the first setup, its a breeze. It rained hard the first night we set it up and it was bone dry in the morning. Screened in porch is great for storage, but not really practical to hang out in. To small.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent withstood a serious thunder storm with multiple inches of rain its first time out. You will need two people to assemble this and it is semi-freestanding, so needs to be guy-lined out in order to function properly. As long as you have room to guy it and someone to hold the conestoga wagon style poles as you assemble this, you'll have a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Hapeman

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Instructions! Instructions are for the Weathermaster 6 not 10. Very different!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Weathermaster 10 but the instructions attached to the bag are for the Weathermaster 6 which has 3 more poles. We thought our product was incomplete and almost returned it. The Weathermaster 6 has 4 sets of poles going across. The Weathermaster 10 on has 3 sets. Once we realized that the instructions were completely WRONG, the tent went up easily.
customer_reviews.author: cyndawg

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Really nice tent. Takes a while to setup but once up it is sweet. Make sure there is NO CHANCE for rain in the forecast if you leave the rain fly off as it takes about 60 seconds with two people to put up and 60 seconds in pouring rain means anything inside gets wet :). Also this tent is pretty tough to live through a strong thunderstorm. It did have some water leakage from around the windows and door but this was a strong windy storm so for the amount of water that came in it did well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This tent withstood the 3 dayweekend on the Beach
customer_reviews.text: We took it to the beach and the detail instructions are great but the poles are not marked correctly. This tent has several types of poles each at a different length. After we set it up the first incorrectly and figured out the length issue it went up quickly and it withstood the winds and the early morning rain show on the beach like a champ. There was room for two queen beds but not much walking around space but we all slept comfy. The oversize bag is a great idea since there is always no way to repack it back like the mfg.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Negrete

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My wife, toddler, and I used this tent 3 times over the summer. We really enjoyed the ease of setup, and all that space. Can’t really comment on how it holds up in rough weather. We only had 1 occasion were it rained slightly, it held up well. Completely disregard the instructions provided, they were totally useless. The middle poles have a colored band(ours was red), the poles at the ends are interchangeable. That’s really all you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: No so weather master
customer_reviews.text: The tent was great size for my family of six and I know better but I figured with a name like weather master it could hold up to rain but i was wrong the tent leaked and the next time i use it i will be putting a tarp over the top for added protection other then getting wet tent was great plenty of room easy to set up and easy to pack away
customer_reviews.author: christopher p freund

customer_reviews.title: All around great tent.
customer_reviews.text: It was a very large and sturdy tent and it definitely braved a few storms with the end windows open no water came in it was pretty great. One person can set it up if you stake the bottoms first. The hinge the door was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good tent. The height is more than sufficient for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tent. The height is more than sufficient for me. I'm 6'1" and feel quite comfortable. Setting it up single handedly takes about 20 minutes and is very intuitive--a standard set up for a tent of this type. The idea of having the screened sun room aside from the sleeping chamber is really cool. I sit there and eat breakfast. There is a divider wall for the main chamber, but it might be for people smaller than me. I inflated a queen sized mattress in the main chamber and had enough room elsewise for my gear and a chair, but not if I had put the divider wall up. The hinged door is also really, really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Agnarr bjarnylr

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made product.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in February, and camped for the first time this weekend. It was an absolute disaster. All the seems around the windows leak. There’s also a hole in the corner of the tent. We basically woke up getting rained on. Apparently I’ve missed the return to amazon deadline by 3 weeks so I’m stuck with this tent that is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: solomom

customer_reviews.title: ... two nights in 48 degree weather and it was awesome. We easily fit a queen air mattress on ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this for two nights in 48 degree weather and it was awesome. We easily fit a queen air mattress on one side with room enough on each side of the bed for storage and walking, and our two young boys slept in bags on the other side....we could have put two lawn chairrs inside as well and sat watching them sleeep! The hinging door is a real bonus with young kids - they open it like any other door, though the velcro clsoing mechanism leaves something to be desired with kids under 8 (which we have). Otherwise, it was easy to set-up and tear down.
customer_reviews.author: jlight

product_meta.title: Coleman WeatherMaster 6-Person Tent with Screen Room
product_meta.description:
Size:6 PersonKick back, relax, and watch nature unfold before your eyes with the Coleman WeatherMaster 6-Person Tent with Screen Room. Great for car camping and extended camping trips, this outdoor tent has a separate floorless screened room that offers extra ventilation on warm days, protected storage, and a bug-free place for meals. This camping tent is designed with the WeatherTec system that features patented welded floors and inverted seams to help you stay dry and includes a rainfly for extra weather protection. The tent offers enough room for 2 queen-size airbeds and comes with storage pockets to help you keep your things organized. The angled windows improve air circulation without letting water in. A hinged door allows you to effortlessly enter and leave the tent, while an E-Port makes it easy to bring electrical power inside your tent. Made of durable Polyguard fabric, this 6-person tent will last season after season. The Coleman WeatherMaster 6-Person Tent sets up in about 20 minutes and packs away securely in the included expandable carry bag that lets you tear away the rip strip for easy packing.

AMAZON.COM




A patent-pending hinged door provides easy entry and exit, and a touch of at-home convenience. The Coleman WeatherMaster 6 Tent has two rooms and plenty of space for the entire family. Up to six campers can sleep easily inside thanks to the 17-by-nine (W x D) footprint and 6 ft. 10 in. center height. Two doors�including a patent-pending hinged front door�offer easy in-and-out. An additional floor-less screened room provides extra ventilation on warm days, a great place for meals and gathering, rain or shine, and protected storage space.  Coleman's Comfort System allows excellent ventilation control via Variflow adjustable airflow, a vented Cool-Air privacy Port, privacy vent window, and all-mesh ceiling. A convenient electrical access port lets you run a cord from your device in the tent to an outside power source, while an interior gear pocket helps you keep things organized. 

 Setup is quick and simple thanks two color-coded poles and continuous pole sleeves, shock-corded fiberglass poles, an exclusive pin-and-ring design, and InstaClip attachments. Straightforward instructions are sewn into the convenient carry bag, and separate stake and pole bags are also included. 

 Coleman's WeatherTec System
This proprietary series of interworking features keeps the weather where it belongs�outside the tent�at all times. 

 * Leak-free Seams: In addition to fully-taped rainfly seams, the rainfly covers doors and windows, and incorporates easy-to-use Velcro frame attachments 
 * Weather-resistant Fabric: Coated polyester fabric combined with anti-wicking thread, webbing, and zippers are designed to keep you dry 
 * Protected Seams: Inverted floor seams dramatically increase weather resistance by hiding needle holes inside the tent, away from the elements 
 * Waterproof Floors: Welding technology strengthens the tent floor and eliminates needle holes 
 * Zipper Protection: Zipper cuff adds protection from the elements to the door 
 * Wind Strong Frame: Engineered to be a stronger, more wind-responsive frame by using redesigned poles and guy-out triangles to anchor tents and increase performance 

 Specifications


 * 75-denier polyester taffeta fly 
 * 68-denier polyester mesh inner tent 
 * 1,000-denier polyethylene floor 
 * 19-millimeter steel poles 

 The Coleman Limited Warranty
Coleman has been in business for more than 100 years, and continues to produce high-quality, affordable tents, lanterns, table-top stoves, and more. All Coleman products have a warranty against defects in material and workmanship, and the WeatherMaster 6 Tent includes a limited one-year manufacturer's warranty. 

 About Coleman Outdoor Products
More than 100 years ago, an entrepreneurial young man named W.C. Coleman had an idea for manufacturing better lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. A century later, Coleman's current catalog features a wide-ranging array of products that make spending time outside a pleasure. The company crafts coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days, airbeds that are comfortable and won't deflate during the night, a complete line of bright and long-lasting LED lights, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and more.
feature_bullets: Spacious 6-person tent has enough room for 2 queen-size airbeds
Separate floorless screen room offers bug-free lounging
WeatherTec system with patented welded floors and inverted seams to keep you dry
Measures 11 x 9 feet with 6-foot 8-inch center height; screen room measures 9 x 6 feet
Rainfly and expandable carry bag included

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
